result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmie A. Oliver

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

9:19 AM Cases called: 22CF262/22CF271 Defendant Jimmie A. Oliver in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Jimmie A. Oliver.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel to efile waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court examines Defendant, accepts said waiver, and binds matter over for trial. State files the information. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:07 AM Cases called: 22CF262/22CF271 Defendant Jimmie A. Oliver appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Robert Buckett appeared by video for Jimmie A. Oliver.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel advises matter will be waiver of preliminary hearing and waives time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Attorney Buckett will accept appointment of case.

8:43 AM Cases called: 22CF262/22CF271 Defendant Jimmie A. Oliver appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court examines Defendant on status of providing additional info for evaluation of PD. Defendant has not provided information. Court will appoint counsel.
Status hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney. Forwarded to Clerk RF for review.

2:06 PM 22CF262/22CF271 Defendant Jimmie A. Oliver appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews case history.  Court examines Defendant on status of counsel. Defendant requests court appointed counsel. Attorney Dvoran advises PD office did not receive verification of home ownership. Discussion. Court finds good cause to extend time limits and adjourns for State PD to confirm representation and for Defendant to complete court appointed attorney form.
Status hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status hearing on September 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

9:32 AM Cases called: 22CF262/22CF271 Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jimmie A. Oliver appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody. Court examines Defendant on status of counsel. Defendant to contact PD for evaluation. Court continues to find good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Clerical error corrected in Clerk's minutes

No contact with: Victim A or their mother. Defendant to avoid the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by the victim. The defendant avoid contacting the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact the victim. Contact includes: contact at victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. No contact with any females under the age of 18. Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Not to leave the State of Wisconsin. Surrender any passport to Ozaukee Sheriff Department or Grafton PD. Not to possess any dangerous weapons.

1:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jimmie A. Oliver appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Jimmie A. Oliver as a Friend of the Court. Counsel requires additional information to evaluated Defendant for representation. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $150,000 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests low cash bail. Counsel waives time limits and requests status.
Status hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
